summary: An Ordinance appropriating the sum of One Hundred ($100.00) Dollars from the Lighting Fund of the City of Seattle to pay the claim of S. Peffer for personal injuries received by S. Peffer on the 31st day of August, 1914, by being struck on the head with an insulator, allowed to drop from a light pole situated on the southeast corner of First Avenue South and Yesler Way, in the City of Seattle, and authorizing the drawing of a warrant therefor.
